member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Differencing.IDifferenceBuffer
member.summary: A difference buffer constantly computes the differences between two s, providing an , , that contains the differences between the two s in an inline difference.

remarks.para: The differences are computed on a background thread in response to various changes (text change, options changing, etc.), though all of the events around differencing, like , will be raised on the thread that owns the and (generally, the UI thread).
Because the differences are computed asynchronously, the may be behind the current versions of any of the buffers, and will be null before the first difference is computed.

If is null and this value is also null, then the beginning of the document will be used as the search's starting point.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.Undo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the specified number of undo operations and places the transactions on the redo stack.
member.param: The number of undo operations to perform.
member.remarks: At the end of the operation, the specified number of visible transactions are undone. Therefore, the actual number of transactions undone might be more than this number if there are hidden transactions above or below the visible ones. After the last visible transaction is undone, the hidden transactions left on top the stack are undone as well, until a visible or linked transaction is encountered, or the stack is completely emptied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.Redo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the specified number of redo operation and places the transactions on the undo stack.
member.param: The number of redo operations to perform. At the end of the operation, the specified number of visible transactions are redone. Therefore, the actual number of transactions redone might be more than this number, if there are hidden transactions above or below the visible ones.
member.remarks: After the last visible transaction is redone, the hidden transactions left on top the stack are redone as well, until a visible or linked transaction is encountered, or the stack is completely emptied.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState
member.summary: Holds the state of the transaction.
member.remarks: There are five rough groups of transactions. Open transactions are being defined. Canceled transactions have been aborted and are empty. Completed and undone transactions have been defined and are ready for undo and redo, respectively. Undoing and redoing are transient states as the transaction passes between completed and undone. Invalid is a state for transactions that have expired.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Open
member.summary: Represents the initial state of the transaction, after it has been created and before it is canceled or completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Completed
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction is no longer being defined, and is eligible for undo.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Canceled
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction is no longer being defined, but has been aborted and cleared.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Redoing
member.summary: Indicates a transient state set by Do(), between the undone state and the completed state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Undoing
member.summary: Indicates a transient state set by Undo(), between the completed state and the Undone state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Undone
member.summary: Indicates that Undo() was called after completion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Invalid
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction has been removed the undo history stack, for example because it was on the redo stack when a new operation cleared the redo stack. Once a transaction is invalid it should not be used for anything.

member.remarks:
This pattern matcher uses the concepts of a 'Pattern' and a 'Candidate' to to differentiate between what the user types to search and what the system compares against. The pattern and some are specified in in order to obtain an .
The user can then call this method repeatedly with multiple candidates to filter out non-matches, and obtain sortable objects to help decide what the user actually wanted.
A few examples are useful here. Suppose the user obtains an IPatternMatcher using the following: Pattern = "PatMat"
The following calls to TryMatch could expect these results: Candidate = "PatternMatcher" Returns a match containing .
Candidate = "IPatternMatcher" Returns a match containing
Candidate = "patmat" Returns a match containing , but will be false.
Candidate = "Not A Match" Returns .
To determine sort order, call .

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatcherCreationFlags.None
member.summary: No options selected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatcherCreationFlags.AllowFuzzyMatching
member.summary: Signifies that strings differing from the initial pattern by minor spelling changes should be considered a match.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatcherCreationFlags.IncludeMatchedSpans
member.summary: Signifies that spans indicating matched segments in candidate strings should be returned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatcherCreationFlags.AllowSimpleSubstringMatching
member.summary: Signifies that a case insensitive substring match, but not a prefix should be considered a match. This covers the case of non camel case naming conventions, for example matching 'afxsettingsstore.h' when user types 'store.h'

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatcherCreationOptions
member.summary: Defines context for what should be considered relevant in a pattern match.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatcherCreationOptions.CultureInfo
member.summary: Used to tailor character comparisons to the correct culture.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatcherCreationOptions.Flags
member.summary: A set of biniary options, used to control options like case-sensitivity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatcherCreationOptions.ContainerSplitCharacters
member.summary:
Characters that should be considered as describing a container/contained boundary. When matching types, this can be the '.' character e.g. Namespace.Class.Property, so that the search can tailor behavior to better match Property first, then Class, then Namespace. This also can work with directory separators in filenames and any other logical container/contained pattern in candidate strings.
signifies no characters are container boundaries.

member.summary: Creates an instance of .
member.param: Used to tailor character comparisons to the correct culture.

Characters that should be considered as describing a container/contained boundary. When matching types, this can be the '.' character e.g. Namespace.Class.Property, so that the search can tailor behavior to better match Property first, then Class, then Namespace. This also can work with directory separators in filenames and any other logical container/contained pattern in candidate strings.
signifies no characters are container boundaries.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind
member.summary: This enum is NOT ordered. Sorting based on the PatternMatchKind is performed in and is subject to change. Additional entries can be added at the bottom of this enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind.Exact
member.summary: The candidate string matched the pattern exactly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind.Prefix
member.summary: The pattern was a prefix of the candidate string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind.Substring
member.summary: The pattern was a substring of the candidate string, but in a way that wasn't a CamelCase match.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind.CamelCaseExact
member.summary:
All camel-humps in the pattern matched a camel-hump in the candidate. All camel-humps in the candidate were matched by a camel-hump in the pattern.
Example: "CFPS" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "cfps" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "CoFiPrSe" matching "CodeFixProviderService"

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind.CamelCasePrefix
member.summary:
All camel-humps in the pattern matched a camel-hump in the candidate. The first camel-hump in the pattern matched the first camel-hump in the candidate. There was no gap in the camel- humps in the candidate that were matched.
Example: "CFP" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "cfp" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "CoFiPRo" matching "CodeFixProviderService"

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind.CamelCaseNonContiguousPrefix
member.summary:
All camel-humps in the pattern matched a camel-hump in the candidate. The first camel-hump in the pattern matched the first camel-hump in the candidate. There was at least one gap in the camel-humps in the candidate that were matched.
Example: "CP" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "cp" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "CoProv" matching "CodeFixProviderService"

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind.CamelCaseSubstring
member.summary:
All camel-humps in the pattern matched a camel-hump in the candidate. The first camel-hump in the pattern did not match the first camel-hump in the pattern. There was no gap in the camel- humps in the candidate that were matched.
Example: "FP" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "fp" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "FixPro" matching "CodeFixProviderService"

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind.CamelCaseNonContiguousSubstring
member.summary:
All camel-humps in the pattern matched a camel-hump in the candidate. The first camel-hump in the pattern did not match the first camel-hump in the pattern. There was at least one gap in the camel-humps in the candidate that were matched.
Example: "FS" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "fs" matching "CodeFixProviderService" Example: "FixSer" matching "CodeFixProviderService"

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind.Fuzzy
member.summary: The pattern matches the candidate in a fuzzy manner. Fuzzy matching allows for a certain amount of misspellings, missing words, etc.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKindExtensions.CompareTo(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.PatternMatching.PatternMatchKind)
member.summary: Compares two values, suggesting which one is more likely to be what the user was searching for.
member.returns: A negative value means kind1 is preferable, positive means kind2 is preferable. Zero means they are equivalent.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Tagging.IAccurateTagAggregator`1
member.summary: Aggregates all the tag providers in a buffer graph for the specified type of tag.
member.typeparam: The type of tag returned by the aggregator.
member.remarks: The default tag aggregator implementation also does the following: for each over which it aggregates tags, if the tagger is , call Dispose() on it when the aggregator is disposed or when the taggers are dropped. For example, you should call Dispose() when the content type of a text buffer changes or when a buffer is removed from the buffer graph.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Tagging.IAccurateTagAggregator`1.GetAllTags(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets all the tags that intersect the specified of the same type as the aggregator.
member.returns: All the tags that intersect the region.

remarks.para: This method is used when final results are needed (when, for example, when doing color printing) and is expected to return final results (however long it takes to compute) instead of quick but tentative results.

The default tag aggregator lazily enumerates the tags of its objects. Because of this, the ordering of the returned mapping spans cannot be predicted. If you need an ordered set of spans, you should collect the returned tag spans, after being mapped to the buffer of interest, into a sortable collection.
If the underlying tagger does not support , then .GetTags(...) is used instead.

member.summary: Gets all the tags that intersect the .

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Tagging.ITagAggregator`1.BatchedTagsChanged
member.summary: Occurs on idle after one or more TagsChanged events.

remarks.para: This is a batched version of the TagsChanged event. One or more TagsChanged events are accumulated and then raised as a single BatchedTagsChanged event on idle using the Dispatcher.CurrentDispatcher that was active when the ITagAggregator was created.
This event is less noisy than TagsChanged and is always raised on the thread that was active when the ITagAggregator was created.

member.summary: Translates this point to the with the given tracking mode.
